sense.name: a duty or obligation
sense.commentary: REQUIREMENT[+activity][+social][+duty] Note: {requirement PREP NP/COMP} requirement is an attribute of the NP/COMP
sense.examples: The requirements of the job include three graveyard shifts a week. The only requirement they placed on their daughter was to be home by midnight. The requirements of overseeing the emergency room put a lot of stress on Bob. FEMA's requirement of

sense.name: a need or essential
sense.commentary: REQUIREMENT[+condition][+need][+primary] Note: (requirement PREP NP) implies that (requirement EQUAL NP) Also: requirement BE NP (again, equality)
sense.examples: No one could satisfy Sally's constant requirement for attention. The artist's only requirements were a pen and a piece of paper. China's requirements for more energy may have contributed to higher oil prices.

sense.name: a prerequisite for achieving a goal
sense.commentary: REQUIREMENT[+condition][+need][+subordinate][+previous] Note: (requirement PREP NP/COMP) implies (requirement NOT EQUAL NP/COMP) Note: requirement is a separate precursor to the NP in the COMP
sense.examples: He couldn't pass the physical requirements for becoming a Marine. There is no essay requirement for that college. Countries must first meet certain economic requirements before joining the EU.
